document.masterDocTitle: New mite species of the genus Cunaxa (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from the Crimea, Ukraine

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New mite species of the genus Cunaxa (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from the Crimea, Ukraine

subSubSection.paragraph:
Idiosomal dorsum (
Figs. 21
&
55, 56
). Chaetotaxy as in
C. gordeevae
sp. nov.
Main part of propodosomal plate smooth, but near bases of vi and sce some papillae occur, and there is an oval area near sci , formed by short broken striae (
Fig. 55
). Central part of hysterosoma with thin, distinctly lobed (=with festoons) striae (
Fig. 56
). Lateral parts of idiosoma with papillated striae.

Idiosomal venter (
Fig. 22
). Ventral surface with thin, broken striae, which in the anogenital region is papillated. Chaetotaxy as in
C. gordeevae
sp. nov.
Borders of genital valves vaguely discernable, their surface with numerous papillae. Genital setae subequal in length.

Etymology. The specific name
maculata
(from Latin: macula = stain) refers to presence of oval area of broken striae on the dorsal propodosomal plate near setae sci .

Differential diagnosis. This species differs from all known species of the genus, and the closely related
C . papuliphora
sp. nov.
, by the presence of an oval area of broken striae on the dorsal propodosomal plate near setae sci .

Type material.
Female holotype , Ukraine , Crimea, vicinity of settlement Morskoye, in soil under oak
Quercus pubescens ,
15 .X. 2005
(Coll. Sergeyenko, A.L.). Paratype : 1 Ψ, with same data as holotype .
Location of material. Holotype and paratype in NBG.
